frameDefinitions: An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
A Group is described as having members which are similar or dissimilar to each other.
This frame contains words that describe a set of individuals which possess some Commonality, generally a common attribute.
A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
An Item which encompasses characteristics or types whose diversity is indicated by adducing a Limit1 and a Limit2 which differ considerably from each other.
This frame contains words that describe a Boundary between two Entities.
frameExamples: Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but we have <t>modified</t> it in order to make our writing more cohesive.
The <t>diversity</t> of students here is to be applauded . INI
The canyon is the <t>border</t> between the two states.
listRoleDefinitions: The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.
The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
An event that causes a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose diversity is at issue.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the <fen>Group</fen> is assessed.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Group is diverse or homogenous.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area in which diversity occurs or exists.

This role denotes the people in possession of the Commonality. This role is usually genetive, the object of a postnominal PP, or null instantiated (INI), and null instantiaton often implies the public at large, as in 'the common good'.
This role denotes an object or attribute which is jointly posessed by the <fen>Entities</fen>.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
One of the possesors of the <fen>Commonality</fen>. Can be singular or plural.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> or an <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>.
A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>, a <fen>Controlling_situation</fen>, or a <fen>Controlling_variable</fen>.
A situation whose temporal or other characteristics control a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
The <fex name='deg'>Degree</fex> to which the Controlling element affects the Dependent element.
The <fex name='tim'>Time</fex> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The first-mentioned possibility of the range of variation.
The second item of the range of variation.
The range of positions on the scale that the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The region which is between the Entities or between the Entity and empty space.
The entity that has a <fen>Boundary</fen>.
The joint construal of both <fen>Entities</fen> next to the <fen>Boundary</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The system administrator</fex> changed the value from 'KDE' to 'GNOME', and then restarted the system.
Her time with the Healer Craft has changed her <fex>from a shy, nervous young girl</fex> into a confident (almost) young woman
The radical message of the cross transformed Saul of Tarsus and changed him from a persecutor of Christians <fex>to a tender believer</fex>.
We changed the size from 8 1/2x11 <fex>to a larger 11 x 17</fex> and gave it a complete graphical makeover.
My dad changed his hair color <fex>from red</fex>  to blue today.
We changed <fex>the price</fex> from $1.26 to $1.27 per pint.
The recent terrorist attacks had changed <fex>the political climate</fex>.
<fex>Major technological innovations</fex> changed the social and economic conditions.
He changed it <fex>after David Bowie told him that only twerps have the same first and last name</fex>.
<fex>In his own room</fex> he had modified nothing.
Their shared <fex>parents</fex> were their only similarity.
Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to control <fex>playback speed</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: The Years of Rice and Salt
